reviews.review_msg: In my opinion, Prof. E deserves a much better rating than this. This class was taught studio style, and I absolutely loved it. You watch the Achieve videos and do experiments to help you apply concepts. He is such a sweet man and always answers questions so patiently. Tests were very fair, and he would scale them if we struggled. I 100% recommend.

The studio format is different from your typical lecture format. We watch videos before class and learn the material, while in class we do activities in groups and have to submit reports. Dr. Emberly always answers our questions and is there to help. The midterms and final were fair, and we were given lots of weekly practice problems

Fantastic professor, I took studio-style phys101 in Surrey with him and it was great. He would repeatedly stay after class to answer all of my group's questions and he was great at explaining tough concepts making them clear! If you're debating taking Phys 101 at Surrey (probably studio style) it feels like a high school class and is very engaging.

As some reviews might suggest, Dr. Emberly 100% deserves a better rating. Sure at the beginning it took him a bit to get comfortable talking about simple topics in front of us but once he realized that we were all engaged during his lectures he started to go into detail and made learning each topic very easy. Office hours were awesome and frequent.

I found it really hard to focus on his lectures. Most weeks had 2 assignments due on the same night (Friday). Exams were pretty difficult. There apparently were 2 profs this semester that switched halfway through that I didn't notice, but they have the same teaching style so doesn't matter.

He was nice to talk to and was willing to answer questions. Classes were in the studio format which was kind of strange for me but as long as you study the activity guides and practice questions youll do well on exams.

Super nice prof but take class as lecture format and not studio format in surrey as he just hands a booklet and expects you to apply your knowledge learnt from assignments. Midterms and exams are fairly easy if you study your assignments and booklets. He takes the higher midterm mark from the two midterms.

He is a really good professor. The only thing is, don't take this class with him in Surrey as studio format. Take it lecture format and you are set. He is extremely nice and gives easy and fair midterms and finals. Recommend him for this class!!

If you ask/email him questions he is very thorough, patient, and polite to students. Many students dropped the Surrey class bc its in studio form (aka lecture  labs) but it made TA/prof more available. Lecture material minorly tested on, exams mainly ALL TEXTBOOK QUESTIONS!! Know how to do the ques he listed and you will ace the course.

Although his notes are pretty clear and somewhat easy to understand, it's his attitude towards the entire class that makes me feel bored and sleepy during the lectures. Midterms are pretty easy though, especially the Final Exam. Getting at least a B shouldn't be too difficult...

Clear lectures. Exams were easy but i lost too many marks because I skipped steps....ie they are marked like high school exams. Overall I enjoyed his class, and I felt bad when he got all choked at the last class when someone opened the door at the back of the lecture hall and yelled 'Mr Clean'....

At first I wasnt really to keen on him and his bio questions in a physics class.. But then he got really good , he doesnt try to trick you and he wants you to the best thats possible, Very nice and caring guy too

Well. He is quiet and not very animated. However, he is the ONLY teacher I've had in sciences so far that can actually teach! I wish more teachers were like him, because I feel like I'm learning nothing at this school...
Good notes, exams straight forward. He doesn't try to trick you.  Very helpful and nice.  Take physics with him, he makes it bearable.

He was good at first when he said that the course will have lots of refrences to biology, but then later he got lazy and decided to assign us to read the text and him going over the examples in class. He is a good prof, very knowledable in bio and phys. unfortunately people verbally attack him during lectures calling him 'mr clean' and etc...
His explanations are thorough  and his notes are good, but he can get quite monotone and boring.
No Comments

More clear than Curzon (joint prof) but also also more quiet. However, I don't know if he is easy because both the assignment and test are written by  the 2 profs. The assignments are somewhat challenging, but my concern are the funny Q's.

Well, he is joint teaching with Curzon at this time so it is not easy to compare their teaching (because I rarely have him). However, he is a lot more helpful than Curzon. He would answer your e-mail questions and gives you the exact information you need. If you have Curzon with him now, ask him Emberly for help. At least he respects students.

He has no control over the class. The lecture halls were always noisey and he talks quietly because he's nervous teaching. Spent too much time going over review things (newtons laws and energy conversions) and not enough in the later chapters.
Did he write some of these reviews himself?!

His notes are unclear. He is unclear. This course when he is teaching: unclear. The best thing about this guy that he would mess up all his deminstrations. A warning: take this class with someone else teaching.

he's not very clear...his notes aren't too helpful...you need to get a lot out of the textbook to do well in the course - when I took the course his midterms were really funky but the final was decent - he was helpful in the open lab though

He's actually an OK prof. His class might b a lil bit boring and his notes r somewhat vague & brief, but he's usually there when u need help. I bombed my 1st midterm but got a really good final grade, so I guess he tries to give as high a mark as possible to everybody.
I've had enough bad physics teachers in high school to appreciate a good one. Takes you through things slow and clear, and despite whats written below he's a fine communicator.
Decent.  I've had MUCH worse.  There was no language barrier which was REALLY nice to say the least.  I didn't really like what I got in the class personally.  Do the practice problems!  They help.

This guys a great prof.. his midterms and final are more about understanding the material than mad number crunching, really takes interest in what he does and very helpful with questions.  I am alot more interested in taking more physics courses now because of this prof.

i dont like his teaching much and he's usually deriving every possible equation even the ones we dnot need to know.  he does look like moby.  i think he looks like the lead singer of the watchmen too.  must be the baldness.

He puts you into sleep when you are tired, he puts you into sleep when you are NOT tired...He seems like a nice guy, but not a great communicator, not a great teacher. Not clear and boring boring boring all the way! If you are willing not to rely only on lectures, go for it.

He is the worse prof ever! probably cant even teach high school physics...he made so many errors during lecture, can't explain concepts, he seems like he doesnt know what he teaches, midterms and hw are killers! nothing like the lecture or textbook
Seems like an alright guy, strange resemblence to Moby. Terrible midterms,all multiple choice for physics? gah!
He wroks very hard, and tries to explain the concepts clearly.
Very patient and helpful.  You can tell he enjoys teaching and truly cares that his students learn.
ARGGH..... I hate this prof. Most useless prof I ever encounter in my life.

Without a doubt the worst professor I have ever had. Does not deserve the privelege of being called a professor when he cant teach anything. Just does his silly experiments and makes mistakes on the most basic problems. You are completely on your own to survive in Phys 100 with him. Wait to take it with someone else, anyone else.
I would rather work at walmart than take another class with sarah johnson.

I feel fairly indifferent towards prof Johnson. I think the way she structured tutorials and assigned homework was very helpful in making sure I did enough practice for the exams. But at one point it became too much for me and I started to skip and miss deadlines. I found this course extremely challenging but also I'm just bad at physics.

Dr. Johnson made physics feel not as scary is physics usually feels. She does move fast through topics, but she does it well. Very considerate/helpful when talking to her about progression through physics in university.

Too many assignments due each week. Though this is supposedly a physics course for the life sciences but barely anything on the exams and homework assignments had anything to do with life sciences. Like why were there so many rocket/spaceship questions of the exams. If anything this feels like an astrophysics class rather than life science LOL.

The workload isnt her fault as all physics classes have the same structure (both 100 and 101 at least) but the amount of work in these courses is completely unmanageable. It took up all of my time and my other courses suffered, so take one less class or something. Her lectures were very concise and helpful. Lenient marking on difficult midterms.
Too much homework was given and the mandatory pre lecture videos where hard to keep up with 3 times a week. Second midterm was super long and hard. In class example problems where helpful.

She gives SO much homework per week, this class took up 90% of my time. There are pre-lectures + HW questions that take 30 min to finish before every lecture, online HW every week AND written assignments. Her lectures offer basically no help as she relies on the pre-lectures to teach students the material. She doesn't really know how to teach.

Lots of homework and no regard for workload from other courses. Prof also adds random/unrelated content on exams and rushes through learning. The prof is also too lazy to even give lectures during regular class sessions and makes students watch online pre-lectures from an outside source. She does however provide good conceptual questions in class.

Horrible experience. way too much homework means time you could spend learning material is instead spent trying to keep up with the graded content. Literally not learning a thing, just completing homework to get a grade. terrible and not understanding. avoid if possible
Teacher gives out way too much work and rushes through content
Not accessible outside office hours and she just repeats whatever was said in the Achieve.

Dr. Johnson was a really good prof. We had 3 midterms/tests. The 1st was tough due to timing issues. She fixed the timing for the other 2 which were much more fair. The diffculty of the exams and final were just as hard as the achieve homework, written assignments and tutorial worksheets. She often goes over examples in lectures. Understand HW A

If you're ever going to be in her class, I would say drop it but if you can't, make sure you REALLY understand the concepts. Focus more on the concepts rather than actually doing the problems because her exams are heavily concept based (and pretty difficult). Anyways, im gonna need therapy now, I hope you have fun.

The prof was easy to understand, and she explains lectures very clearly. There were 4 tests and a final instead of midterms. One con is that we are not allowed to go back and check our answers during quizzes and tests.

Sarah is a pretty solid prof. She gives out tons of homework. Her lectures are decent. The test averages were extremely low but she would scale them. Multiple choice is very hard and the written section was always quite easy. Tutorials are mandatory.
Her tests were difficult but the homework assignments and tutorials were worth 30% so it balanced out the grade. She also scaled pretty fairly. She wasnt THAT bad cmon now.

I thought she would be okay but honestly after we got the second midterm it got so bad. The midterms were unlike anything we had learned in class or done as homework. We were also unable to go back and look at questions once we had answered them. When we brought this up she said "it would be like that if we were in person too". Don't take her class

Dr Johnson seems very passionate about her work but GOODLUCK on her exams. study as much as you want and you may pass the tests��. as a class we have asked many times to change the format of the exams (have the ability to skip questions and go back) but she definitely does not want to. so goodluck in this course and have fun��

Her lectures were enjoyable enough but don't expect any of your learning between lectures and sapling videos and homework practice to help you on tests. Tests have nothing to do with the learning in the course and you're better off guessing for multiple choice. Class averages always well below 50 and she never considered making them fairer.

gives out part marks for written part but the canvas portion of the exams are brutal. nothing like what she goes over on lectures or even sapling. its pretty much impossible to study for the exams, the multiple choice is very unfair

I was really excited to have Dr. J as she was really fair in the beginning of the semester. After experiencing her midterms, do not take this class. They are nothing like her homework, or what she teaches. The class average for these tests right now is significantly below failing. Do not take this class unless you want to retake it in the future.

Why is this prof even paid... she literally does not teach anything you watch pre-lecture videos that are each max 3 minutes long which look like they are off a random YouTube channel. The pre-lecture videos have no useful examples and lectures are repeats of the vids. Are professors not paid to teach? She doesn't even provide basic instruction.

Overall, Dr. Johnson's lectures are not so helpful.   For the midterms and final exam, I suggest going through all the written homework solutions and mastering physics multiple choice questions.  Her midterms/finals are in between fair and difficult.  This course requires a lot of self-teaching.

Has a wierd rubric for marking where she wants like all of the formulas written out that are used to answer to questions. It's easy to loose lots of half marks for stupid reasons however once you adapt you it's no big deal. 4.5/5 Proff Im taking  PHYS 102 with her nxt semester ;D

Her concept of time is non-existent. Essentially, only an hour is given for 3 long written questions and 10 heavy-calculation multiple-choice. Teaches all the topics as if it's a review for everyone & doesn't really consider/care about those who struggle with it. The few examples given in class often aren't applicable when doing textbook practice.

A prof who teaches you how to make instant noodles and expects you to know how to make lasagna on exams. Lots of hw questions and you have to do something every other day. Not a lot to know, but a lot to do almost everyday, such as the prelecture questions. Hw consists of both online and written, which are usually due on the same day! They're hard.

Doesn't fully explain how to approach problems and the course is largely self-taught. Merciless when it comes to midterms, she doesn't go easy on you. Half of the online physics homework questions are at a ridiculous difficulty where you HAVE to search the answers online. Written questions on the tests don't seem fair especially the way she teaches

If you can get past her somewhat annoying voice and dull pitch, this course is safe to take without too much sweat and tears. You can half-sleep through lectures as long as you review the notes she puts down. Her tests are fair and she seems nice enough to help out anybody. Would recommend taking this with her, its a safe choice.
Really good prof. The class is a bit tough but she's always super clear. Lectures are to the point, with excellent notes posted online every time. If you have to take 101, do it with Sarah Johnson.

I took 101 and 102 with Dr. Johnson. Her lectures were pretty boring in my opinion and materials could easily be self-taught. That being said, you probably should attend lecture since there is iclicker questions. Midterms and the final were fair.
Sarah is very organized and plans her lectures very well. Her notes and examples were very easy to follow. The exams were very fair. I would highly recommend taking PHYS 101 with her.
Awesome Prof
Friendly, fairly organized prof who makes an effort to get one on one time with students for a few hours a week. Do the hmwk and you should be okay for the final. She made physics bearable.

Don't take this course at the studio lab in surrey. You are not taught but instead receive activity guides and are required to do work and find out things for yourself. Then, you use this information for homework and exams without knowing whether or not it is correct

her classes in my opinion are usually self taught, but if you ask her questions personally, she does a descend job explaning.gives part marks for mid terms and exams, she picky on sig fig and using proper formula notations. homework, is usually fine if u read and understand the textbook. Exam easy she allows study guide, WRITE DOWN ALL FORMULAS
Somehow, he has a disrespectful manner in the discussions.

Explains material very clearly and is willing to help and answer questions in class. There is a lot of homework, but it helps you out in the long run. Midterms and finals were fair and are based off of homework. In lecture he sometimes ask for a volunteer in the audience to help perform some demonstrations which are very engaging. Awesome prof.

He posts his notes online and gives a list of textbook problems that are relevant to the course (which I'd suggest doing because very similar questions showed up on the exams). Clear lecturer, went over lots of problem solving strategies in lecture which was awesome. Tons of online homework but it honestly helps to keep on top for the midterms

Sivak was an awesome, funny prof and was super caring. He did tons of examples in class, which were similar to exam material and tried his best to make the material interesting. 10/10 best physics prof!

Very bad notes, studying for an exam and reading them again they make no sense AT ALL. There is way too much homework, almost everyday of the week!!! Seems like a chill guy overall but i do not recommend him as a prof.

Sivak is a really chill guy. He explains lectures very well, and gets straight to the point. Encourages a lot of questions, and if most people don't get a concept, he'll go over it again during the next lecture. If you attend lecture and do the homework, you're golden. Not very heavy. The tests were very fair and based off the practice problems.

Respected, chill, fresh, cool looking prof. Good lecture notes which are posted online so attendance isn't mandatory, but its recommended. Exams are fair, not too difficult or too easy. Not the best at answering questions, but a great lecturer and great at explaining concepts in class.
Lots of clicker questions. Interesting lectures and he teaches well.

She is a nice lady, but her lecturing skills are very poor. She struggles to speak clearly, remember the content, and organize her lectures. It can be very difficult to know whether you have the right idea regarding a certain topic in class, because she often doesn't know either. Spends class time doing problems she doesn't know the answer to-AVOID
Can't complain, average experience. Found that those who self studied heavy did better than others. Lectures are okay.

Wasn't an awful professor, but her inability to communicate efficiently through email, and just her use of technology in general, was a very considerable disadvantage she had with the class. However, I would say she was decently kind and approachable yet her lectures were also a mess and handwritten, which is was just unreadable and no help.

Her exams weren't unfair, and she does provide examples that are similar to the exams. That being said, she is not a good lecturer and you will have to learn all the content on your own time. Especially if physics is a weakness, I do not recommend you take this class with this professor.
Slides often messy or showing incorrect solutions that are changed after class. Doesn't know how to use iclicker properly so technical problems can cause you to lose marks.
Just don't do it.
horrible wouldn't wish it upon my worst enemy
Super confusing lectures and concepts are not clearly explained and explanations just leave you more confused than you were before. Cares more for iclickers and doesn't really explain them anyways.
Probably the worst prof I have had at SFU. Going to her lectures leaves you more confused then when you went in. She doesn't even know how to work iClicker.

The lectures and notes are not useful at all.Her explanations are not clear or helpful  during lectures. Simon was a great instructor, ensuring everyone understated the material and each achieve question. But the second instructor doesn't even give us the correct answer for achieve and she needs to understand the lecture before she teaches it!

The professor does not understand materials enough to teach students. She keeps making mistakes which makes the lecture more confusing than it seems to be. She's struggling explain the concept so pretty much I have to ask T.A for help.
Doesn't teach material and relies on Achieve Prelectures. iClickers are confusing and doesn't even really give the correct answer at the end.

I am not saying that you can't still get a good grade in the course if you put in the work, but from an objective standpoint she is a terrible prof. I went to every lecture but they always confused me more and she seemed just as confused as we were. Though Karen's teaching was a total gong show, the exams were fair so the class wasn't a total bust.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! Do NOT take physics 101 with Karen, You'll leave the class knowing less than when you went in. Absolutely terrible. Give you the wrong formulas during lecture and doesn't even notice. Students have to shout at her to get it together Expects you to understand her notes, but its jibberish Re-taking the course with a real prof.

Dr Kavanagh is not the most organized prof and her lectures are variables with no numbers and no context. It's very confusing and the tutorials aren't any better. The mastering physics code costs $80-$90 and it is only worth 5%. Her practice exams don't come with answers so it destroys the whole purpose of having a practice exam.

OK so, I thought I could take this class and do well even her bad ratings. I'm telling you now, don't do it, especially if you're not strong in physics. Her exams lack any resemblance to the reviews, you can't follow her notes at all because she just doodles around. This course should be easy but she makes it difficult.

If you get this prof, get ready to learn everything yourself. i have never seen a prof this bad at teaching. She gets confused over her own lectures and iclicker questions. (no joke, we spent 30 mins for one iclicker question because she confused everyone and herself). Her tests are okay IF you can teach yourself. Written homework is dreadful!

I pride myself in being successful  in handling bad professors by selfteaching myself the material and doing a lot of question. BUT THIS DOES NOT WORK WITH HER.  I did ALL the questions of the textbook, assignment, tutorial repeatedly and successfully, still managed to get my first ever C+ .  Her exams are unpredictable and her lectures are useless

Had seen reviews, but thought it wouldn't be too bad - was a poor decision to take with Karen.  She knows a lot about physics but has difficulty teaching it to students, often becoming confused while going through her own notes or when asked questions by students.  Midterms and finals were somewhat fair, but weren't entirely related to lectures

I found coming to her lectures made the concepts more confusing than it already is. The notes that she gives are literally random numbers and signs, and NO explanations of the concept what-so-ever. Her exams are very random, as majority of the content on the test were barely covered in lecture! Grade was saved by the curve tho!!

Dr. Kavanagh has a difficult time teaching this class because the level of study she does is so beyond basic physics. She jumps right into problems in lectures without giving sufficient theory. If you do have a to take a class for her I HIGHLY RECOMMEND you read ahead and learn the concepts before lecture so that you understand her problems.

Dr. Kavanagh was not a very good instructor, due to poor explanations of concepts and lack of organization in lecture content. I did not find that this course was very difficult, however, and easy to learn on your own by doing textbook questions. All it takes is a little effort.

By far the worst professor that I've ever had in all of my undergrad. She lacks the ability to communicate with her students in lectures, often times mumbling to herself while attempting to solve questions. Very confusing and disorganized lectures. Always thinks shes right despite majority of the students disagreeing with her.

Take physics with anyone else. Very poor at explaining concepts in class. Was often confused when lecture ended. Prepare to self-learn the entire course. Practice midterms, textbook and homework Qs will not prepare you for very difficult exams. Tutorials are unhelpful and disorganized. She does scale the grades though but GPA will be ruined.

She cannot explain a concept for the life of her, the lectures were useless, she was unable to finish an example or solve an equation during lecture. The average on the second midterm was well below 50% and she still would not admit that it was too hard of an exam. Do not take this class it is horrifying
Confuses herself in lecture. Says she'll get back to you with an answer, never does...

Before i took this class i was hesitated if i should take her course or not since EVERYONE says she is terrible at teaching. Now im taking her course and regret that i didnt listen what others saying. Its so confuse to understand her. I feel like she is just murmuring herself explaining concept and nobody has idea about it. Plz dont take her class
The most confusing prof I have ever had. Has no idea what she is talking about what so ever. Students constantly have to correct her, and then she will argue with them as to why they are wrong

Lecture notes are hard to follow as they mostly consist of poorly drawn diagrams that are left unexplained. Material and concepts were not too difficult and can be easily be learned using online sources. She also often gets confused when answering student's questions. Would not recommend unless confident in learning most of it yourself.

Lectures are so confusing that she gets lost on her own notes. Tutorials are totally irrelevant to material on exams however it is worth 5% of your total grade. Exams are ridiculously hard compared to assigned homework. Grades are scaled at the end of the term.   tl;dr She is a very nice person but a terrible prof. Would not recommend.

All in all it was a very mixed class. Lectures were confusing and hard to follow but none of the material was THAT bad. She uses a lot of demos/examples, sometimes without context and they work some of the time. Miderterms (and final kind of) are savage, you'll feel great if you can get mid 60s, but she scales her grades at the end so it balances

Terrible at explaining concepts in class, and get confused when people ask her questions. Tests are way harder than any written homework she assigns and are harder than any textbook/ mastering physics question and are super unrelated to what we have even learned. Do not take this class with Karen you'll get a back grade. 0/10 do not recommend.

Karen is a great person, however, she is not the best lecturer.  She has lectures written out ahead of time and is very willing to take questions, but 90% she gets confused with the questions and goes on unrelated tangents.  A lot of times I would leave class very confused about what she was even talking about.

everyone on here is on drugs Karen is awesome compared to all the other profs Ive had at this school yaaa if you don't like going slow and solving problems by drawing pictures than you need to not take physics folks end of story

no idea what was happening in this class. I ended up not going to lectures 'cause I found it pointless and a waste of time since she write her notes with confusing drawings and formulas that are unexplained. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!!!!!

Avoid at all costs! She doesn't come to lectures with structured notes, she just comes with a pen and notepad and draws pictures and writes random formulas without clear explanations. Exams are very hard and do not pertain to what is covered in lecture or tutorial or the homework and she always seems surprised when students don't get the concepts.

Extremely unorganized class overall, tutorials are next to useless. Karen sometimes gets confused trying to solve her own problems and in the process makes students more confused, even if they had come into the class thinking they had a pretty good background of the topic. Midterms are quite random and sometimes don't pertain to what's taught.

Do not take this class with her!! Midterms have nothing to do with what she teaches in lecture or what is taught in tutorials.  She's a nice person but she cannot teach and her lectures are usually confusing.

Dr. Kavanagh seems to have a great passion for physics and seems to be a very kind person. Nevertheless, I have to say that her lectures are incredibly confusing!! I was even confused about what she was saying when she was teaching material that I already knew!!! Her tests have very strange questions that her assignments don't prepare you for.
Trust me when I say not to take this class with her. Her homework and the textbook do not come close to helping you prepare for her exams.
Brutal...

She's a great prof, super caring and a fair grader. She wants her students to do well as it is a reflection of her teaching! She is very clear about what will be on the midterms and gives plenty of examples. Some problems on the exams come straight from the homework so do your review. 10/10 a great professor!

She is an amazing prof, took the time to explain complicated topics and ensured all students understood the concepts. One of the best I've had at SFU, gave plenty of opportunities for additional learning :) Physics is one of my weaker subjects and I still managed to enjoy lectures

Joanna was one of the best instructors I ever had! very thoughtful and she tried to make physics easy as much as possible. She gave a relatively good amount of homework and assignments, which had 2 benefits: 1) You had many opportunities to boost your grade. & 2)You had so many extra (and optional) practice questions to work on.

The best prof you will get for physics! Attending lectures and getting poll questions 100% right means an extra 5% in the overall grade. Cares a lot about her students, and even let us do some questions of the midterm at home for extra credit. The course isn't easy, and requires a lot of extra practice, but she gave all the resources. Tip: Read TB!

Joanna was decent. PHYS 101 isn't one of her favourite courses, as she is more into her astronomy course. She would often confuse herself and get lost during lecture, in turn causing us to become lost as well. She was very caring and gave 5% bonus for poll questions during class. Final exam was heavily scaled, and class average final grade was a B
I enjoyed this class. She was very caring and generous so you should try your best and appreciate her. Do all the practice problems lol

Great at everything except writing finals. Her mc for midterms were easy and most q were not bad or from her notes. But midterms didnt have much time. The final was a completely diff story. She contributed mainly the last chapters. It had avg of 50 and extremely difficult to understand what she was asking us to do. I enjoyed the class though.

Take This call with Joanna No Question about it. Best Physics prof thus far in my 2.5 yrs at Simon Fraser. She actually cares (unlike many others at sfu) about her students learning, and academic progress. Her lectures are rich in detail, and she makes them extreeemley entertaining for physics lectures with her awesome personality and fun demos.

She is truly one of the best profs I have had until now. She is really passionate about the material she teaches, which really show through her lectures. Although I never really enjoyed physics, I was able to really see it through a different lens this semester, just by the way this course was taught.
her course format was really helpful in learning physics. just the right amount of homework, plus she gave you opportunities to improve your grade
Sweetest prof, very considerate and very good at explaining and connecting concepts

She is very organized and is great at explaining stuff with and without physical proof. The midterms were kinda easy, but the final exam was brutally hard. There was a lot of homework, about 4,5 hours a week, but the homework was were helpful. Overall, a good class with a good prof.

Midterms very fair, but the final was EXTREMLY hard! Attendance is mandatory if you wanna get iclicker marks. Her teaching skills and method is amazing!! She's very good at carefully going through the concepts and explaining everything very well via doing example questions with the class. She has midterm reviews (some review Q came in that midterm

Wasn't sure about Joanna since she was a new professor, but I loved the way she explained things. I took more notes from the textbook than hers, and did all the hw she assigned. It was DEFINITELY hw heavy (around 3 hours for online hw every week) but they helped me write a good midterm. Final was brutal though... she loves her Road Runner problems.

Did not like the format of the class. Found myself spending the class hurrying to hand write her notes rather than take in the material. Wouldve preferred either recorded lectures, or pre-posted notes to aid in understanding. Definitely passionate in the material, but found the class to still be hard to understand.

She's new and a lot of times she was discovering how to do things. I don't think she's a bad teacher just needs some experience. She also sometimes doesn't answer the questions asked, properly. But she's very nice and caring. She wants you to do well.

The way she ran the class gave room for potential grade increase that was not test dependent. With regard to her teaching she could spend more time going through examples and less time deriving equations. Rarely did class examples and if she did she always ran out if class time and would rush through the question and was difficult to understand.

Shes clearly a new prof, does everything by "the books". Not a good lecturer, not terrible either. Class was un-enjoyable and had a bad flow. Spends too much time deriving equations and does not go through examples in class. Shes confused about what to put on the exams and exam difficulty is inconsistent. Over all not great, worse than the average.

She is new to teaching, and you can already tell she enjoys her job and wants you to do well. The class lectures were pretty interesting sometimes. Homework is a must. If you focus on the homework you will do well on the exams.

Joanna is a very kind and knowledgable physics prof. Physics is often a difficult subject, yet she is able to make it enjoyable and help you grasp the many concepts. She often throws in some puns to lighten the mood, and loves going into detail about astrophysics (very passionate). She wants you to do well in the class, and it shows! Amazing prof!
He is a very nice and approachable person. His lectures are easy to follow as long as you put in the effort. His exams were fair. I would definitely take a class with him again.

Wow what to say. I found his lectures good and I really like him as a person. However the textbook and any of his examples in class aren't exactly relevant to his tests. Mastering Physics was kinda and it was helpful. Practice test for final was extremely helpful. The tests are hard but I was scaled up intensely...

He's an extremely nice prof. I'm glad i had him. His exams are pretty hard, so study! But other than that, homework and attending tutorials will help boost your mark a little. He's very nice and tries hard to help you understand the material during office hours. All in all one of the better profs that i have had!

He's a very good professor if you go to his office hours, 'cuz that's when he really tries to help you understand the material 1 on 1.  Lectures were sometimes funny with his demos, and he posts up practice exams and review questions on WebCT..which are very useful because half of the material was from those.. Challenging tests but it was fair game

Extremely hard midterms/final, examples gone over in class elementary compared to homework/exams. Enthusiastic with lots of demos. Enjoys making the raw class average around 50% (seriously!). To do well? Do practice questions that he gives you and maybe textbook questions.
Damn hardest tests ever. They make you want to beat the crap out of something after.
Horrible prof...Doesn't know what he's talking about. Exams are super hard and he even admits to it himself. The notes don't match up with the exam questions...
His exams are so hard!!!!!!! Think before taking it!!!!
Hes a great guy and does a good job teaching unless of course your lazy. Listen to what he says in class and study assignments for good grade.

His use of demos was great and broke up the dryness of the material. The exams were fair, study the examples he uses in class as well as the problems assigned. Overall Jeff is a good teacher and I'm glad I had him for physics.

Slackers, stop complaining. If you are taking phys101 with him. You are in for a cool journey. He has a unique sense of humor, and always amazes the class with neat experiments. Exams ARE difficult but everybody finds them difficult(curved!) So don't worry and be happy

Ok so his exams are super hard. You would think that after 2 hard midterms the final would be somewhat fair...NOT FOR HIM. His lectures are pretty useless. Gives no hints to whats on the exam. Scales really well but honestly the class makes u feel down 80% of the semester. Take his class at your own risk

Exams hard, textbook examples are simple and fool you into thinking you can do it - but then exams come along and you end up shocked. Prof is ok, but more suited to teaching the engineering physics than physics for life sciences. He is helpful but lectures and notes are confusing and too in-depth.

Lectures are extremely boring and his examples are useless and confuse everyone. Material is hard and he does a terrible job teaching it. Always gets his examples mixed up. YOU MUST LEARN PHYSICS ON YOUR OWN VIA TEXTBOOK. avoid taking physics with him unless you don't want to understand anything

Really nice professor to have. He cares about your success in the class and he is always open to questions. Make sure to understand the questions he does in his class and the questions on FlipIt Physics.

Rasoul is one of the most genuine and caring professors ever. Is he a perfect professor, no but he is there to help you reach your goals along every step of the way. One of the best things you can do in his class is contribute and ask questions, which will make his class even more productive.

Had rasoul as a lab tech in my phys 101 studio format in surrey, very approachable and helpful during and after class. Never had him as a prof, but would love to take a class with him! Super friendly dude.

Simon is a good guy and he knows his stuff. The way he presents his lectures isn't the best, so it can be hard to follow. Your grade in the class is basically fully based off what you do outside of class and then if you can follow along with his example videos given that you do the pre-lecture. He doesn't really teach, just reads over his calcs.

I really liked his lectures and typos/spelling errors didn't bother me as much, but beware there are a lot. He gave us lots of demos in class. Lots of homework and iclickers for bonus marks. Tutorials are mandatory and significant part of the grade, it's a double-edged sword cause it's an easy mark, but not everyone likes attending tutorials.
Simon is the best prof I've had so far, he gave me a reason to respect physics lol
Simon is a solid professor, very fair and easy to understand.

These reviews from 1st yrs make Prof Watkins sounds WAYY worse than he is. Tbh, for someone who's not the best at physics, I would that putting in the work and actually asking him questions helped. Yes, the tests were hard but what do you expect? its Uni. And he was more than generous when scaling. Overall 9/10 recommend - very nice guy overall!!

One of the best profs I've had. He is very clear in lecture and goes over a lot of practice problems. His office hours are great to go to as well, he goes as in depth as you need and makes you feel like theirs no dumb questions.

People in my class this term were a bit melodramatic all semester long. Simon was a fine lecturer, there were rare errors in the lecture slides as he hand wrote them live but it wasnt a big deal. One of the exams covered things we hadnt, so our average was low but Simon shifted our marks for that to make up. I would take another class with him.

Honestly, Simon was alright. His lectures were pretty disorganized and all over the place, but he's a pretty kind person. Exams were okay - some were pretty challenging but he accounted for that. Overall, the course was just "eh" - not great but not the worst. Similarly, Simon is not great but not the worst.

I found it really hard to focus on his lectures. Most weeks had 2 assignments due on the same night (Friday). Exams were pretty difficult. There apparently were 2 profs this semester that switched halfway through that I didn't notice, but they have the same teaching style so doesn't matter.

I don't find him to be disorganized - his lecture slides are partially hand-written so can sometimes be messy, but he is always happy to clarify and takes lots of time to answer questions. I'm not a fan of physics, but Watkins makes it fairly straightforward and gives lots of examples, and exams have been reasonable so far.

He really isn't someone who should be teaching an online course. His notes are all handwritten and extremely disorganized and messy. He also makes lots of stupid mistakes during his lectures such as using incorrect signs or units. The pre-lecture assignments he assigns are super helpful to help understand the lecture! He definitely isn't the worst

Worst prof I have ever had. He is so disorganized and blames us for his mistakes. He had the audacity to get mad at me when he made a mistake and I corrected him. WARNING TO EVERYONE: clear out your weekends, he gives you the assignments on Sunday if they are due on Monday.

He is VERY disorganized and often makes mistakes on lecture slides, homework assignments, and exams. He will also upload assignments inconsistently and often within a couple of hours of the deadline. Do NOT take ANY classes with him online.

Dr. Watkins is a great prof! He is extremely helpful. Tests are fair and based on his lectures. He is friendly and approachable during his office hours and gives clear explanations to student's questions. At first, I thought he was going to bland but he cracks pretty good jokes at times. Definitely a solid choice of a prof!
Found the tests to be somewhat relevant to the lecture. He gives a lot of homework, but I found that it has helped me a bit with the final and midterms. MC was hard though.

This is an amazing professor! I'm taking three classes and even though I'm not one of those engineering students who are passionate about physics, his is my fav. lecture. Best notes, patient, trying to help students as much as possible, plus you can screw up on one midterm since he only counts 2 out of 3 if that works best for you.   love this prof

One of the best physics profs at SFU.  He explains things clearly and his notes are easy to read.  Midterms are fair/easy if you study and do all the CAPA assignments.  Plus...he shuts up the people who are noisy in class.  He is "THE ENFORCER" of SFU!!
Very good at explaining concepts, and well-organized notes. You can tell he loves what he does, and he's very helpful as well.

His notes are easy to read. So even if you have no idea what's going on in class, if you read the notes, at least you'll be able to comprehend them. Quite nice if you get to know him. Demos are way cool

He is a very good prof.  He give clear notes, and explain the stuff very well.  His experiments are very interesting, and he is a very nice guy.  He know his stuff very well.  Lecture is very interesting, not boring at all.  His exam might be a little tricky.
Listening to him talk makes me angry.  I'm never going to class again!
clear and concise, enthusiastic about physics, and helpful
great guy, knows what hes teaching
Has a clear voice. Lecture notes were alright. Homework was tricky!
His notes and his examples were very useful. the hmwrk was a little tough.  the exams were fair, but very long and the multiple choice were tricky
Lecture notes are very helpful~ Midterms are easy but the final is really a challenge~! Nice teacher though~!

took the course for fun, he makes the class interesting with some demonstrations, gets pissed off when ppl are late and when ppl talk. easy first midterm, second and final are killer. but if u do all ur capa, shd get an A at least
midterm one is easy but midterm 2 and final is hard. however ,this course is not a tough one,do ur job u will get a- easily.

He's not a bad guy, but he goes through the notes very fast and is a little hard to keep up with.  The CAPA is challenging, and the notes are mostly derivations of equations but exams are mostly conceptual so watch out!

While I was dreading PHYS, Dr. Watkins is an excellent professor if you're willing to put in some work. This isn't high school children. CAPA assignments were very intense, but prepared you well for the midterms. Dr. Wakins provides material in a straightforward manner and is very approachable.

I've always hated physics, but found this course managable. Have to admit that the homework was tough, but if you go through his notes and read the text it's not that bad. Exams were alright, except for the long 2nd midterm...just written badly.
absolutely horrible.  the course is mandatory, and he doesn't make it any more enjoyable.  bad examples, bad notes, ridiculously hard homework, extra-long midterms...
Not only he seems to hate students, he must hate helping others as well. I heard him telling other student that he doesnt have time to help them out. Well, it was his office hr.

argh physics. not only do I hate it I hate it even more when it's taught badly. Open lab is only open the day before and the due date of the assignments. If you don't read the textbook along with his notes you will be completely lost. His notes are messy and he throws a million variables at you
midterm 2 is hard but the course is easy one.
He knows his stuff but doesn't know how to explain it clearly.  He overcomplicates questions and his homework is very tough.

He overcomplicates problems and give incredibly challenging homework, although he marks really tough his tests are prettu easy. Also he is super-boring, and be prepared to teach yourself some of the material
this guy has the easyest tests ever. the questions he gives on homework are way harder than on the midterm, he's kind of agitated in class tough, doesn't stop speaking
The worst prof ever. A lot of people couldn't even read the notes he put on the overhead. Difficult midterms and final exam.
great physics teacher, knows how to teach u so you understand: By giving you lots of hard assignment questions. Unfortunately also the exam questions are hard...

HIs notes were straight forward and they followed the text well.  I did well because I did all his suggested text assignments and asked him lots of questions in the open lab.  HIs exams were hard, but they were fair.
the course was easy for me, but i saw few people were having hard time. oh yeah.. the phone. never turn on your cellphone in his lecture he kicks you out!!
No Comments
tests are reasonable. Even though hard, it tells you what university is, not some baby test. Very helpful, so basically if you try and go to OPL, you'll like him, and get good marks, cause i do
I like how we write out the notes because then I learn something and stay awake, and I am able to follow along with the lecture.  However, his midterms are quite difficult.
there's only one word to describe this guy "terrible"
Simon Watkins teaches well, but he doesn't know how to make an exam, extremely challenging, and has very high expectations for his students, thinks physics is the only course his students are taking

Fairly intimidating demeanor during lecture, but if you actually try speaking to him during open lab or after class, he's extremely approachable and helpful. Found myself looking to him for help more than TA's. Exams are reasonable.

Talks to the overhead rather than at the students.  Really fast speaker and writer.  Difficult to keep up with him.  Slightly unclear at first, but his notes actually work quite well with the textbook.
Very easy course at least to me. The prof is kind of dull and stuck up. He is not even as good as some of the TAs.
Super hard prof
The goat. Funny and fair. Fair grading schemes and fair content on exams. W Chen
Bro doesn't scale and removed iclicker to put more weight on final. Shame.... physics hard enough
Horrible prof, no other words...

He was a headache to understand in lecture with that thick accent. No wonder 2/3s of the class stopped coming after midterm 1. His class also didn't have any iclickers like past physics classes making the final worth more. While he was a kind guy, I would recommend taking it with a different prof as all the material will be self taught

Dr. Chen is a very caring prof and I wish I could take another course with him again. I think he may have unfortunately retired as he is no longer listed the SFU physics department. He made awkward jokes which were pretty comical at times. The achieve homework was a lot at times but I think it makes sense for physics. Love this guy, he was so chill

Michael Chen was a great guy himself, while it was hard to follow through with his lectures due to his accent he genuinely wanted to see his students succeed in the course. There is lots of homework so try to stay on track of that. He omits your midterm marks if you do better on the final and his exam written questions are from his lecture slides.

Gives informative and sometimes funny lectures and Michael is extremely helpful during office hours. As long as you keep up with the homework and lectures you should be fine in the class. Most of Michael's exam questions come from the online, tutorial and written assignments. Make sure you do the homework thoroughly and ask questions.

A very nice and funny prof. He makes sure you understand and checks in with the class to encourage questions during lectures. Lectures aren't that interesting but it is bearable. He is kind during office hours and is very fair. His exams are mainly based off of the assignments and previous practice exams. Textbook is not really needed.

He's one of those professors that  tries to be funny but it gets awkward and his awkwardness makes it funny. Physics in general for me is awful but Dr. Chen made the course more bearable and the midterms and final weren't too bad. The grade you get TRULY reflects how much effort you put into the class.

It was a really fun and engaging class. He definitely made lectures more enjoyable by adding in his little commentary and jokes every now and then. As for assignments and exams, none of that is really difficult and he tends to reuse questions from previous midterms and also gives a head's up on that too!

Unclear about anything that has to do with the class: notes, deadlines, criteria. Unable to explain examples; horrible at teachingexplaining concepts. May have been a decent prof a few years ago but now he's the worst.

Grade really reflects how much effort you put in. No trick questions. Midterms were easy breezy. Q's were everything you've seen before.(1 written each from lecture, MP, written assignments). Final exam was alot tougher. Class avg was in the 70s. A+ was 95%+ and an A was 90 and above. Best Phys prof at SFU for sure!
studied for the final for just one day and got B+. It's hard to fail this class. and I'm not a smart guy.

People, this class is a JOKE! The midterms were a breeze, I'd get them done in 25-30 mins and the final was assignment questions with different numbers. Study MPhysics, assignments, lectures and come to class. Dr. Chen's great, he loves physics and he loves teaching! An easy A is guaranteed if you take this class with him!

I do recommend him for others but uv got to understand that he does not have tolerance for stupid questions. I ended his class with an A there were a lot of haters in his class who failed. do all his hw questions and his tests are easy. 3 term tests and a final.

How is his rating not a 4.5?! great prof! Midterms are straight from the iclickers and mastering physics and class examples. really wants everyone to do well and he has his hilarious "cant believe that old chinese man just made that joke" joke once in a while. I had little interest for this course before taking it. obviously not a super easy course

I'm not naturally good at physics, but if I read the textbook before class his lectures made sense and were helpful.  It was a good class overall, as long as I stayed ahead in the readings.  His midterms are very fair. Expect 1 long-answer Q from Mastering, one from homework, and one from his examples.

The only reason to go to class is to for the iclicker questions. The multiple choice of his tests are basically the clicker questions and the rest is from homework. If you can do the homework questions you should do well on the midterms/final. For the final he reused some of the same homework questions. It helps to study some of his past tests too

hes one of those teachers that seem boring in the beginning but then after is actually quite interesting. He has a very serious sense of humour; he seems so serious when he jokes = all the funnier. And he DEFINITELY knows what hes talkinga bout. I could tell he knows all his topics INSIDE OUT.
Mumbler

If you actually pay attention, he does make sense. He was particularly helpful during office hours, while lectures were useful for reinforcing concepts after doing the readings. Overall not a bad prof, but if you're not pro-active in your learning or are weak in physics, you'll have difficulty. Midterms + final straight out of assignments.
Seems extremely interested in the course material, however was unable to come down to a beginner's level and convey the material effectively. Lectures were useless.

I do not recommend this teacher for those with a weak foundation in physics, grades are circumstansial, comprehension of theories is key. he does not teach, he does not explain things clearly, and keeps going in circles. I do not recommend taking a course with him unless u are independent and are confident in physics. if u have him, go to the TA's

I think he is a good prof! He places emphasis on actually understanding the material rather than making you do all the number crunching. Exams are reasonable, and he replies to questions that we might have.
Extremely helpful and well-organized notes.  Exams are really fair, but you need to understand the loncapa well.
Dr. Chen is very willing to help, and his notes are clear and organize. Loncapa is difficult, but they prepare you for the final exam. Overall, an awesome teacher with a sense of humor.

Very unorganize. Unable to understand what he is trying to say.  Not sure if he understand what he is explaining.  Always tell us to refer to text book.  It's more useful to read the text than going to the lecture.  Sometimes makes stupid jokes.
As a person, I love this guy!  As a teacher--I've vowed never to go to physics class again, because the textbook is 5 times better at explaining stuff.
Prof Chen is very helpful, willing to change his style to help students understand, and has a nice, easy-going personality... great professor.
Despite some troubles communicating in English, a good instructor overall. Occasionally gave interesting lectures.
A fairly hard course, but Chen made it so you could bomb a midterm or both midterms and still ace the course.
helpful, always welcome students to ask questions, and very patient

SHUT UP JUST SHUT UP SHUT UP...thats the only thing that we hear. Doesn't respect students, his jokes are lame, english is alright. Examinations are pretty straight forward. Goes through a lot of material in a short time frame.

He's a good prof... willing to help and super nice, but he needs to crack down harder on the rude ppl who won't shut up in class.  If you sit in the front and can actually hear what he's saying he makes most things pretty easy to understand.
He explains stuff very clearly. He is funny.
Horrible notes.
He's okay.
very not good
Good demos
very helpful and patient; clear explanations of theory in lectures; prepared; you must work very hard with the text book, notes and past exams to do well, though......wonderful prof
Decent notes and exams. Super nice and willing to help.
hot guy but "namely" crappy prof
His phys 101 is easy, toooooooooooo easy. Exam questions can be found in notes and homeworks. And there's no need to read the text.

Spends too much time telling people to shut up.  Needs more examples.  Needs to decide whether he wants to teach concepts or just teach towards the exams, cause right now, he's somewhere in between and it's confusing.
I found his exams brutally hard. The class average was very low. His lectures are ok but long. Definately read the textbook. And "towtow" mean "total" in whatever language he's speaking.
Uhh... so not "simpoh".  His "exampohs" seemed to stretch on for hours.  And the lecture was only supposed to be an hour.
funny guy, bad english, easy exams
No Comments
I found that the textbook was more helpful than anything he said in class, but I also found it difficult to pay attention.  However, he's a funny and nice guy.
nice prof. easy midterms. easy stuff if u love physics and has done well in phys 12 in highschool.
his examples in class are really important, must be on midterms or final
No Comments
No Comments
Funny prof, great teaching.
the exam questions are like the examples in text book boring lec unhelpful notes
Funny teacher.  Final is hard.
No Comments
very nice+serious prof!! reply e-mail super fast!!! very helpful~ very neat note
Clumsy/Funny person in labs, gives hard questions and easy examples in class.
instructions unclear
Confusing...
Good, Funny teacher.  Teaches with a lot of Math emphasis.

All iClicker are just trick questions that she expects we can figure out in 2 mins. Plus, everything new that she taught (and that's putting it mildly) made no sense, I had to completely self teach. Avoid if ur not good at physics, but if ur really good, you'll probably be fine, only with many more gray hairs at the end of the semester

Midterms were pretty chill. Hated how she made us do exams in groups, it was a waste of time and only benefitted the other ppl in my group. I disliked how she taught certain concepts, I was often confused on how she ended up with certain formulas and what the process was. I wish she did more in depth examples in class instead of just small ones
her practice final was a joke - nothing like the actual final. there is lots of homework and overall a hard course.

Somewhat nice and understanding prof but she expects you to know everything based on homework. Also do not rely on her practice exams, I found them to be way easier than what we were given on midterms and final.
Simin was a good professor and was very nice however, the course material was pretty difficult and sample exams did not correlate with the exams at all.
Sample exams have no correlation to the actual exams and her teaching is not great

I can definitely agree with all these other accurate 1.0 ratings that she is a terrible prof. Her exams are just NOT IT. I don't know what happened from the previous years, but she made it so much harder and just unfair this year. The best advice I can give you is to AVOID taking Simin's classes.
She is not the best teacher when it comes to teaching physics since she barely goes over anyslides and she then expects that you to do homework which tends to be harder then what she teaches.

HER EXAMS R HARD ASF, DONT RELY ON PRACTICE EXAMS. not similar at all. your best chance to do good is either being naturally good at physics or do textbook questions and a lot of practice. (Dont take this course)

Let's start with terrible professor. Her lectures are boring and full of her over explaining formulas instead of actual content. Doesn't review exam study sheet until a day before exam. Exam is NOTHING similar to the exam study sheet or anything that has been taught as she thinks and said in her own words it is "cheating" when its her job dont take
terrible prof... If you only rely on doing her practice exams to help you study for the exams, YOU'RE COOKED

Dr. Simin Najmi is a great prof, she goes through topics in depth and will cover previous assignments and bridge assignments in lectures to provide her students a better understanding and explaining how she got that answer. However, she does give off a lot of homework which can be a bit overwhelming if you have a heavy semester.

She is a very well spoken professor who not only knows the course content very well, but also how to explain it simply in lectures. The prelecture assignments took a lot of time, but were definitely worth it because of how they helped me understand material. The midterms also all had a portion done in groups, which was so helpful.

Dr Simin is great. Absolutely wonderful prof. Can occasionally overcomplicate material in my opinion but is overall very clear, direct and patient with the class. Includes demos which are helpful for understanding and engaging. Midterms have a group portion which I was very hesitant about at first but ended up liking a lot. 10/10
Despite having lots of homework. Simin is very nice. She is good at explaining things and even provides some examples. However, her iclicker questions and exams are tricky.
only expects you to learn from achieve. does not provide any other practice work to study from.
Some people rlly like her, others not so much. depends on your learning style i guess. she is reasonable and wants her students to do well. gives extra 1% for surveys and stuff.

Simin is such a caring prof and she really wants her students to succeed! Her lectures include the topics that most students find confusing and she is always looking for ways to help her students succeed whether that is having less quizzes or assigning extra practice homework. 
Highly recommend her class.
She's always willing to slow down the class if we are not understanding. She cares about her students and wants us to do well. I would highly recommend this professor!
Simin is a nice teacher. Tests are easy if you study too. Lots of marked homework though but other than that, Simin is pretty goated.

She genuinely seems to care for her students. She takes her time to thoroughly go through everything. I however personally didn't think her lectures were helpful for the exams. Achieve took way too much of my time,  especially the pre lectures that I didn't actually have time to practice on my own. Go to her office hours, she's very nice.

Great amazing professor. She is so kind and caring and provides great lectures. Lots of tricky iClicker questions, but as long as you participate and answer them, then you get full marks for them. Lots of difficult concepts but she does her best at helping students to understand. She uses Achieve.

She is very nice and teaches well but I found the lectures were quite hard to follow. It was also annoying to have to use Achieve as I was using up all my study time watching pre-lectures and doing assignments rather than actually learning the material. Exams were quite difficult too, I just wouldn't particularly recommend this course overall.

Professor Simin is nice and takes her time to explain concepts to you. The class I took was a "studio style" rather than lecture based. All we did were activities every class, I personally didn't find it helpful for the exams. The overall course concepts are very heavy so make sure to keep up and review every week.
She was the first prof i went to for office hours and she is so kind and helped us SOOO much. 10/10 experience would go again (going tomorrow)

Andrew is super sweet and accommodating. his exams are very fair and his explanations are clear and helps you solidify your understanding for any concepts. everything is all conceptual/symbolic, only downside was there was no practice final exam. for exams, I only studied off of notes and still got good marks. would recommend!
Jebediah was the main highlight of this course. Reading his name in word problems made me lock in and get an A+.

awesome prof who has two different grading schemes depending on which one you do best. I had him for phys 100 and 101 and his slides are easy to understand! only achieve and written hw no pre-lec questions
the GOAT.

This is probably the only time I will say this but he is the best prof at SFU. His lectures are very thorough and easy to understand. He doesn't trick you at all during exams, all you need to do is pay attention to his lectures. I wish he taught more classes. He also deserves a raise.
convince yourself~ Andrew
"just convince yourself" and you'll do great

literally so amazing and sweet. he is a really good prof and for someone who wasn't good at physics, im doing so well that im considering being a physicists cuz of him LMAO. anyways if u have a choice and want to save ur GPA, take it w him.
Manz replies to emails faster than batman answering to the bat signal

Dr. DeBenedictis is amazing, he is so nice and caring. really wants his students to succeed and understand the concepts discussed in class. he does not go super fast in lectures and repeats topics over to make sure all students grasp the concept. midterm questions came from the textbook just modified so there it is symbolic.

it is only been a month with Dr. D but he is so nice. He explains everything in lectures with ease and repeats things over so his students understand and are not lost. I have emailed him regarding some questions I had and he replies within half an hour, sometimes in 2 minutes LOL. i can't describe how amazing this prof is and how caring. GOAT

Genuinely wants the students to do well and answers all questions respectfully even if its the same question multiple times. Midterms and exams were all multiple choice and great feedback was given quickly

Nice professor and easy to approach. I have always struggled with the theoretical side of physics, yet his notes were outstanding and in-depth. Assignments and projects were weighed more due to covid thankfully:) Overall great prof.

It's amazing how he loves to overcomplicate the material. He talks and writes so much so, you lose track of the importance of the topic, which is annoying. He even admitted that he over explains things. The material isn't all that tough but you gotta believe me when I say I didn't bother looking through his notes bcos they're just too much. AVOID.

A great prof! His lectures and exams are symbolic, which is not what most students are used to, but if you are having some problems understanding a concept, even if it's just a small thing, please go to his office hours! I was never that great at physics but I frequently went to his office hours and it was very helpful. Highly recommend.

The material is extremely challenging especially if you lack a perfectly solid understanding of its pre-requisites. He will write everything on the blackboard with a chalk. He likes to over-complicate concepts when the course is for a first year undergrad. Midterm was fair, but the final was a disaster. He did scale the overall marks significantly.

Andrew is a great prof and gives detailed lectures. He gives you time to catch up with notes and is open to questions. His notes are largely symbolic rather than numerical and he gives lots of example questions. He writes his notes on the board though and doesn't post them so I recommend sitting near the front where you can see. Textbook is unused.

Lecture notes written on chalkboard are very hard to read. Gives absolutely no feedback on work unless you track him down and ask for it. You need to buy the textbook, but never actually need it. I did not learn anything in his lectures and had to turn to the internet to learn concepts. Definitely the worst professor I've had yet.

He enjoys overcomplicating concepts by digging into the core nature of what is being taught. All symbolic, no numbers. As good of an instructor he is, he also likes to take things way deeper than they have to be for a first year physics class. Missing a class would be detrimental to your learning since he never posts any of his notes online.

His lectures tend to over-complicate matters because he likes to get to the core of a subject to make you really understand (which can be confusing). But if you go to his office hours, or any other time (since he's almost always in his office), he is SOO helpful and takes all the time you need to help you with all your questions.

I am currently taking his class and he is amazing. His notes are like Feynman's: conveys the material clearly and concisely-> straight to the point. He does not squander a physics class speaking to us in math. He actually speaks English! Wish he teaches all undergraduate physics classes. I would so major in Physics then!

Overall a really great prof, he's very enthusiastic and clearly knows what he's talking about. He explains concepts very well and his bi-weekly quizzes are extremely fair. The symbolic problems can be difficult to wrap your head around, and attending lecture is a must. Also, his final was terrible.. but pretty sure also heavily scaled. Solid choice

Awesome guy with even awesomer hair. As long as you follow along in class and try your best to understand the hw, you should get a decent grade. Does all notes on the blackboard which forces you to write stuff down, but it helps you and your learning. Midterm was fair, but the final was brutal (pretty sure he ended up scaling it tho)

Andrew was an incredible prof who loved his students. Responded back to emails within the same day and made lectures engaging by using the blackboard. Midterm was rather fair, 3 questions straight from the textbook, final ripped my soul apart... definitely make sure you do ALL textbook questions and attend all lectures!

He is the most engaged professor I've ever had. He always came to class with a smile on his face and a heart of gold. He cares about his students so much, and even with tricky topics, he went out of his way to explain and draw each concepts, made me truly appreciate physics when I saw his love for it. Would recommend to anybody!

Good explanations, straight forward, no tricks. Most of his exams are written only with a few questions, but nearly NO NUMBERS involved. If you can understand the basic concepts and simple Algebra, you'll easily score marks. He doesn't give out any practice questions before exams, so make sure to use the textbook and PRACTICE.

Andrew is very approachable and helpful and has majestic hair. He replies to emails incredibly fast, even outside of school hours. His notes are a little unfocused and not too structured. I found the symbolic methodology very difficult to get used to and the exams were hard. Homework took quite a bit of time each week.
love the hair

Although he is a good teacher and explains concepts well, his notes can be confusing as he often will be talking about one topic then mention a topic we  learned weeks ago. His quizzes and term-test (a midterm) are HARD, they are symbolic, which I personally find difficult to do especially since the homework involves numbers.

Such an amazing professor. Lectures were awesome. You will learn to love the way he teaches. Takes some time to get used to expressing all your answers in variables instead of numbers, but he really explains concepts REALLY well. Quizzes were so easy, all concepts based. Assignments were short. Midterm was pretty simple. Final was harder.

If a good attitude is important to you, take your physics courses with Andrew. Andrew was completely respectful and patient when I asked questions that many grade 10 students could answer (I have been out of school for a long time and was rusty when it came to the basics). Exams are always symbolic, lectures are fun and interesting, and he is hot.

He does not make exams with numbers. Its all symbolic. He is very good at explaining the deeper reason any aspect of physics in this course. He is an extremely good professor, but don't miss class because if you are like me and you don't like physics, he does not make lecture slides so missing class is not an option.

Really enthusiastic about what he's teaching and does his best to make the class interesting and light. Really easy assignments in class and explains course contents exceptionally well. Best physics instructor I've ever had. A solid 10/10

Great guy.  Very nice and patient.  Hard to follow his notes sometimes.  Exams are fair, but be prepared for "home-made" questions that do not look like the ones in the textbook.  Make sure to understand concepts.  Genuine nice guy with great hair!

Such a good prof!! But b sure to go to his class take the notes he writes. Its much more simpler than readin the boring and tedious textbook. His notes help so much wit assignements on exams! The first MT is hard cuz there are no numbers and only a few questions, but final is completely fair and ok if u study off his notes well!
Best Physics Prof ever!

The BEST prof I've had at SFU so far. Made physics extremely manageable. Assignments and exams are very fair. Does not overload you with homework like other profs. Marking is very fair too. He is also VERY nice and pretty much an awesome prof. TAKE HIM FOR ALL YOUR PHYS COURSES. Just be prepared to "volunteer" for his demos!

The semester I took phys 101 with him, he had a set of questions that he revealed to us before the midterms and he used some of these questions on the actual exam! This saved many people's grades (mine included). Also, he's very friendly and his notes are simple and clear.
one of my favourite profs ever. he made everything really simple for us non math/physics people. if you study even a little you'll do decent. very approachable and friendly prof
write something on exam to get part marks
No Comments
Nice prof, friendly and helpful; materials r challanging, just make sure u attend lectures cause the exam questions will be similar to those he does during the lectures; and do ur hw~
Great prof! Very patient and clear at explaining course material. You will be fine if u attend all lectures and study all his notes before final exam.

He is probably the nicest prof I've ever met. Very very nice and helpful. But his tests are HARD. Make sure you go to every one of his lectures. Study lecture notes for tests and don't bother with the textbook and you'll do okay in this class.

Simply the NICEST man you will ever meet! His test's were F'in impossible though; avg for the 2nd midterm was 43%. Only frustrating thing was that exam questions were not "typical" physics questions i.e. your homework...he'd cook up these homemade physics problems incorporating EVERYTHING you had learned thoughout the entire semester into ONE prob!

He's not a horrible one. But his notes are unclear and he doesn't explain enough. I think that he almost assumes that everyone understands all PHYSICS!! His exams are fair but hard.He seems to be a nice man, but I find him very difficult.
No Comments

I am in this class right now, and I am finding Andrew extremely difficult to follow. He isn't a horrible teacher, but I think he should avoid doing so many examples and focus more on explainations because his notes are very confusing and as a result, the course is challenging. Although he is fun to watch. Like a lion or wild man who paces a cage.
She did her best to show and explain concepts in class. iClicker was mandatory almost every lecture, but it hepled in understanding the material. The midterms were traumatizing though.

FLAWLESS. Best prof I've ever had. Such organized lec slides, so helpful during office hours. Achieve homework can be brutal but it's not her fault obviously. Does multiple choice questions in class (if you answer wrong u still get full marks) that are so useful. Takes feedback so well, is genuinely THE PERFECT PROF

Genuinely the best prof I've ever had. Her lecture slides are so organized + she constantly updates material based on questions / feedback. Achieve homework is pretty tough (discord will save you) and there are mini prelecture vids and questions due that actually do help! Iclicker is participation only. Everyone in lecture agreed she's awesome.
Seems to enjoy teaching and knows and presents the material well. Makes you want to go into Physics.

Excellent Prof. Great communications skills complimented by an ethusiasm for all things Physics. Patient and approachable. Does an excellent job of explaining the most complex concepts and theories. Brilliant and easy on the eyes! To all the nay sayers....grow up...it's university....spoon feeding knowledge and information is long over.
Easy A, if you did well in physics 12.

at first I thought he was an okay prof..but after a while I'm just totally lost. His exams doesn't really relate to what he teach, like his examples. His notes are kind of hard to understand when you go back to review them.. but overall, he's not a bad guy just need stronger communication skills. Reading the text may confuse you more, but oh well..
Get ready to completely study on your own unless you are a genius who can absorb tons of new information during the lecture and also later be able to understand his notes by going over them again.

The major issue with this prof is that he does not communicate with his students. He makes constant errors on his notes. Perhaps he is not interested in what he is teaching. He is flexible, though. He is tolerant about assignment redos. He also seems to show interest when students approach him first. So, if in this course, talk to him alot.

This teacher has a strong grasp of physics, but it by no means translates to a good teacher. I can relate to all the previous negative comments: lack of clarity, disinterest in the course, failure to respond to requests for help; they're all too true. If you get this teacher, be prepared to seek help elsewhere.
