Worst possible teacher that I have ever had. He is a good guy. He laughs at his own jokes. Kinda naive type. The problem is that he lacks enthusiasm and helpfulness. Things are not posted up on time. He does not consider if students understand concepts or not. He just speaks and writes down what he speaks.
He is quite condescending and doesn't appear to want to teach a lower level class. When you ask for clarification, he treats you like a moron. Avoid if possible.

the good thing is he records lect and posts up notes, so no need to go to class. the bad thing is it takes him a while to post notes and sometimes they're in the wrong order. pay attention to the practice mc q's in class, he used them on the exams. problems in class were similar to the exam q's. marking is fair. does not respond to emails

agree with previous posters...he might be a nice guy but his teaching ability is slightly lacking. tends to mumble even with the mic turned up, he doesnt explain his notes but rather just reads out the words he writes. on the other hand, his exams are a lot easier than what he goes through in class so make sure you read the book and ull be fine.

If you like repeating classes then take this class with him. He is guaranteed to bring your GPA down. Just because they have a degree does NOT mean they have the ability to teach! This guy definitely SHOULD NOT be teaching!!!

This is by far the worst instructor I have encountered. He does not teach he mumbles, he doesn't post anything on time, weeks will go by without having assignment marks. He will not respond to emails. He is clearly very uninterested in teaching this class. Aviod him at all costs. The TA's teaching abilities were far superior to his.
Amazing teacher
Honestly I think he was a great prof. He was straight to the point and the midterms were straight forward. The final was a little tricky but overall a good prof.
great prof
CUT HAIR SO IT DOES NOT GET CAUGHT IN MICROPHONE!
super enthusiastic :)

She really wasn't as bad as the previous ratings make her seem. She was super friendly and really tried hard to make the class understand the concepts she was teaching. The two midterms were super easy, as long as you did the homework assigned. The final was harder, but that's expected. Class averages were ~70%, which is nothing to complain about.

She is nice... but failed to deliver the material clearly, and i wish she actually solve with numbers too and not just variables. Exam and midterm were  poorly written. Makes a multiple choice question 4 marks/3 marks/ 2 marks each and no part marks awarded so what's the point. Maybe she'll get better, who knows.

Had plenty of bonus questions which helped in the end but her lectures were less than helpful. Her lecture slides were taken from various other physics professors AROUND THE WORLD and when she solved example problems, she wouldn't give us the answer. She'd solve it halfway and say "then do this and do that and you'll get the answer". Shrill voice.

It was her first time teaching a university class, and it really showed. She tried really hard to get her teaching across but it was largely ineffective. You can basically self-teach yourself the course. Provided a lot of bonus marks which is good, the final was very tricky though.

She really cares for her students & tries hard. Her lectures were normally confusing & essentially not very good, but it was her first year teaching at university and I think she will improve. Overall I can't complain because she gave lots of bonus marks and I did better than I thought I would in the class.

not very good. she says she has office hours then cancels them even in weeks before exams. Lecture Notes are incomprehensible. She does examples in seemingly the most complicated way possible and then stops halfway through because class runs out of time. If she says she cares for her students, she does not appear to show it. Need to teach yourself.

if there were no iclicker questions during lecture, this class would be pointless to go to.  you're better off to just teach yourself out of the textbook, If anything, she just makes things harder to understand. Tests aren't too hard though

the lectures are stupidly easy to the point that if you have learned anything about physics, your good to go almost. she gives a LOT of bonus q's and she doesnt scale which doesnt matter too much. the first midterm had a class average of 70%. be warned though half the time in lecture she solves problems way harder than she needs to.
Hard to understand. Her notes come off the textbook and tell you nothing.
Hard to understand and her notes are so simple to the point that there is no use going to class because you learn more from reading the textbook.

He is a good person with a good sense of humor. He smiles at his students and available for help. On the other hand, his exams are very tough, and the lectures notes are messy. He is getting too old and I think that he should retire.

I don't reccommend anybody to take his class. It is impossible to understand his hand writing. He mixes ideas and concepts together when he's explaining and therefore it is hard to know what is what. His assignments are so long and hard. His exams are deadly with low class averages, every time he teaches physics 101.
Funny lectures, but not helpful at all and there's no point to go. Homeworks/midterms/finals are all hard and brutel and time-consuming and he wants you to do everything in INK =(

Course is actually quite easy if you still remember your Phy 11/12. There are no real difficulties except some really weird/unclear pbms in the hwk/test (So many bio related pbms on final). Notes can be messy, but the txt is not hard to read. He also tries too hard to entertain the class w/ his "artistic skills". Maybe he'll be great in art class.
No Comments
His notes suck.
Worst teacher I have ever had. He made every concept seem 100x harder than it really was. Do everything you can to avoid him.

Complete inability to teach. He may know physics but he can't communicate it at all. Tests are far too long with absolutely bizare, rediculus questions. If you want your GPA to plumit take him. But he is nice a person, odd personality, but still a terrible teacher.

He is my worst prof ever! Very unclear lectures! Hard long exams!! Weird long hard assignments!! I think he concerns more on jokes than lecture materials!!! Very silly NOT funny jokes!!!!!! He will just lower your grades! NEVER take his class! You will learn nothing from him!

He even said clearly the first day: e-mail, won't answer. Hey, why are we paying him? Also, he makes you hand in assignment at 9:20 am. Okay, the bus gets to school at 9:20. He doesn't give even a 5 minute buffer. Exams are very long, even you write continuously you might not even finish them (that's what happened to me). Have fun with this prof.
No Comments

He is  very unclear and his explaination is rather hard to understand.  His assignments are soooooo hard and his notes are very hard to read. Very strict on time. He WILL NOT accept homework you hand in after 9:20. Test is better than all of the questions that he gave but still hard.
Very Tough and weird!!!!!!

lecture notes and homework are irrelevant to test. even if the lecture notes where relevant they are impossible to read and the notation he uses is very confusing. class would be alot better if the homwork wasn't some evil little scheme of his.

As much as I hate physics, I don't like him. Weird sense of humour. Bad handwriting (sometimes I can't read what he wrote) and rather challenging assignments. But if you study assignments for midterms, you should be fine. Although I messed up on mine...:(

Interesting sense of humor. Brings all sorts of props and poems in lecs. I have him w/ Emberly, but Curzon definitly have more control over class. I see that he cares about students, but his notes and asns are rather unclear at times. At least he sends email but too often! Very strict about handin and attendence, but tests are easy though q's funny
